result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ryan Michael Thompson appeared by phone at 10:30am for his 8:30am hearing.  Attorney Charles David Betthauser appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court issues $500 warrant, but quashes when defendant appears. Defendant wishes to continue without an Attorney. Defendant is instructed to update address with the clerk of courts. Defendant is also instructed to file a letter regarding a motion to modify bond. Court Adjourns.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

DEFENDANT MUST COMPLY WITH THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM. 
DEFENDANT MUST GO IMMEDIATELY TO THE JUSTICE PROGRAMS OFFICE UPON SIGNING OF BOND AND/OR RELEASE.  
THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM IS LOCATED IN THE MONROE COUNTY JUSTICE CENTER AT 112 SOUTH COURT STREET, ROOM 1008, SPARTA, WI.  
DEFENDANT MUST BE EQUIPPED WITH A GPS DEVICE THROUGH THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM.  
DEFENDANT NOT REQUIRED TO TEST.

Defendant Ryan Michael Thompson appeared by video.  Attorney Charles David Betthauser appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court states that defendant is not eligible for a court appointed attorney. Defendant would like to proceed without an attorney as he is unable to afford one. Charges and max penalties were read. Defendant waives time limits for a preliminary hearing. Email given to DA.
